title: Technical details
code: library(wisselstroom) # making the objects  # To read in your institution specific bekostigingsbestand,  # change path_to_file accordingly. path_to_file <- file.path(system.file("extdata", package = 'wisselstroom'),                            "VLPBEK_2025_20240115_99XX.csv")  # read the data and place it in an R data.frame my_vlpbek_data <- read_vlpbek_data(path_to_file)  # make the my_vlpbek object from the my_vlpbek_data object my_vlpbek <- vlpbek(my_vlpbek_data)   # make the my_vlpbek_compact object from the my_vlpbek object my_vlpbek_compact <- compact_vlpbek(my_vlpbek)

what: vlpbek object as made with vlpbek()
title: Technical details
text: look structure newly made my_vlpbek object: Compared original dataset, VLP record translated first 3 items. rows containing SLR record (totals per record type) BLB records (studycareer totals per student) ignored. BRD records (enrolment) placed enrolment data.frame, BRR records (degrees) degrees data.frame. relevant columns wisselstroom insights included. column academic_year added data.frames, calculated basis date_enrolment enrolments, date_graduation degrees. column student_id calculated two original columns my_vlpbek_data, V2 V3: - V2 contains BSN student - V3 contains onderwijsnummer (educationa number) student - V2 value, student_id gets number , prefixed “b”, short BSN - V2 value, student_id becomes V3, prefix “e” educational number
code: # make the actual my_vlpbek object from the my_vlpbek_data object my_vlpbek <- vlpbek(my_vlpbek_data) str(my_vlpbek) #> List of 5 #>  $ brin_own      : chr "99XX" #>  $ year_funding  : chr "2025" #>  $ date_retrieval: Date[1:1], format: "2024-01-15" #>  $ enrolments    :'data.frame':  181 obs. of  11 variables: #>   ..$ student_id       : chr [1:181] "b700010101" "b700010101" "b700010101" "b700010093" ... #>   ..$ BRIN             : chr [1:181] "99XX" "99XX" "99XX" "99XX" ... #>   ..$ program_code     : chr [1:181] "31001" "31001" "31001" "31002" ... #>   ..$ program_level    : chr [1:181] "HBO-BA" "HBO-BA" "HBO-BA" "HBO-BA" ... #>   ..$ program_phase    : chr [1:181] "D" "B" "B" "D" ... #>   ..$ date_enrolment   : Date[1:181], format: "2022-09-01" "2023-09-01" ... #>   ..$ date_disenrolment: Date[1:181], format: "2023-06-25" "2024-08-31" ... #>   ..$ enrolment_form   : chr [1:181] "S" "S" "S" "S" ... #>   ..$ program_form     : chr [1:181] "DT" "DT" "DT" "DT" ... #>   ..$ sector           : chr [1:181] "GEDRAG_EN_MAATSCHAPPIJ" "GEDRAG_EN_MAATSCHAPPIJ" "GEDRAG_EN_MAATSCHAPPIJ" "" ... #>   ..$ academic_year    : chr [1:181] "2022/2023" "2023/2024" "2022/2023" "2022/2023" ... #>  $ degrees       :'data.frame':  33 obs. of  9 variables: #>   ..$ student_id     : chr [1:33] "b700010101" "b700010003" "b700010057" "b700010089" ... #>   ..$ BRIN           : chr [1:33] "99XX" "99XX" "99XX" "99XX" ... #>   ..$ program_code   : chr [1:33] "31001" "31015" "31003" "31004" ... #>   ..$ program_level  : chr [1:33] "HBO-BA" "HBO-BA" "HBO-BA" "HBO-BA" ... #>   ..$ program_phase  : chr [1:33] "D" "D" "B" "B" ... #>   ..$ date_graduation: Date[1:33], format: "2023-06-25" "2023-07-07" ... #>   ..$ program_form   : chr [1:33] "DT" "VT" "VT" "VT" ... #>   ..$ sector         : chr [1:33] "GEDRAG_EN_MAATSCHAPPIJ" "TECHNIEK" "ECONOMIE" "TECHNIEK" ... #>   ..$ academic_year  : chr [1:33] "2022/2023" "2022/2023" "2022/2023" "2022/2023" ... #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "vlpbek"

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: Official documentation regarding files can found website Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs (DUO) Ministerie van Onderwijs en Wetenschappen: https://duo.nl/zakelijk/hoger-onderwijs/studentenadministratie/programma-van-eisen-bron-ho.jsp. document also describes request files regarding HEI.

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: bekostigingsbestand analysis file specific institution higher education Netherlands contains funding decisions enrolments HEI funding year. order enable HEI check decisions, also contains information enrolments degrees obtained students involved. enrolments HEI, also enrolments HEIs. bekostigingsbestand can requested containing information maximum two years. implies able gain insight programmes enrolled , also enrolment programmes HEI.

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: TDB

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: VLPBEK tells us voorlopig bekostigingsbestand (preliminary file). options first 5 characters DEFBEK (definitive file) HISBEK (historical file) 2025 year funding relates 20240115 date file created DUO 99XX BRIN HEI; BRIN abbreviation BasisRegistratieINstellingen, administrative code size bekostigingsbestand depends HEI. larger university applied sciences, maximum time horizon can around 15MB (voorlopig bekostigingsbestand). file format UTF-8 coded csv, “|” delimiter. file can considered container 5 different sub files records intermingled. sub file type interpretation columns, order interpret value specific column csv, needed also know recordtype. screenshot example bekostigingsbestand:

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: first step work bekostigingsbestand, read R data.frame: reading data, checks made filename. sure original filename.
code: library(wisselstroom) # This is the path to the example file. # To read in your institution specific bekostigingsbestand,  # change path_to_file accordingly. path_to_file <- file.path(system.file("extdata", package = 'wisselstroom'),                            "VLPBEK_2025_20240115_99XX.csv")  # read the data and place it in an R data.frame my_vlpbek_data <- read_vlpbek_data(path_to_file)

what: A closer look at the data.frame
title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: Every row csv file becomes row data.frame. separator csv file splits row columns. 25 columns read character. columns given general name (V1, V2, …, V5), since content can different meaning depending sub file type. order gain insight wisselstromen, need content bekostigingsbestanden. example file, content x-ed . first 10 rows 9 columns: first column denotes sub file type row: first row row, “VLP” (voorlooprecord) metadata “BLB” records (bekostigingsloopbaan student) metadata regarding student’s study career “BRD” records (bekostigingsresultaat deelname), details specific enrolment student “BRR” records (bekostigingsresultaat resultaat), details specific obtained degree student last row row, “SLR” (sluitrecord) containing number BLB, BRD BRR rows data.frame useful want see csv actually contains. use gaining wisselstroom insights, use columns, sub file types. need part data. mext step.

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
code: # make the actual my_vlpbek object from the my_vlpbek_data object my_vlpbek <- vlpbek(my_vlpbek_data)

what: A closer look at the vlpbek object
title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: my_vlpbek object list containing 5 elements: brin_own: administrative number HEI concerned year_funding: financial year funding disbursed date_retrieval: date original bekostigingsbestand made enrolments: data.frame containing enrolment data degrees: data.frame containing data obtained degrees Compared original dataset, VLP record translated first 3 items. rows containing SLR record (totals per record type) BLB records (studycareer totals per student) ignored. BRD records (enrolment) placed enrolment data.frame, BRR records (degrees) degrees data.frame. relevant columns wisselstroom insights included. column academic_year added data.frames, calculated basis date_enrolment enrolments, date_graduation degrees. column student_id calculated two original columns my_vlpbek_data. want address one 5 items my_vlpbek object, can $ operator, instance: my_vlpbek$brin_own get text containing brin my_vlpbek$enrolment get data.frame containing enrolment data get summary insights, can make compact_vlpbek object

title: Introduction to wisselstroom
code: # make the actual my_vlpbek_compact object from the my_vlpbek object my_vlpbek_compact <- compact_vlpbek(my_vlpbek)

what: A closer look at the compact_vlpbek object
title: Introduction to wisselstroom
text: my_vlpbek_compact object list containing 7 elements: brin_own: administrative number HEI concerned enrolments_degrees_compact: data.frame compact enrolment data, adorned degree data applicable presences_brin: data.frame summary data per student regarding enrolment brins presences_level: data.frame summary data per student regarding enrolment levels switches: data.frame containing data switches (program without degree another program) summary_presences_brin: presences_brin per academic year summarised students summary_presences_level: presences_level per academic year summarised students

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martine Jansen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jansen M (2024). wisselstroom, R package obtain insight patterns study programme switch.
code: @Manual{,   title = {{wisselstroom}, an R package to obtain insight in patterns of study programme switch},   author = {Martine Jansen},   publisher = {Center for Educational Data Analytics (CEDA), NPuls},   year = {2024}, }

title: Gain Insight In Switching Studies
text: Higher Educational Institute (HEI) Netherlands can request institute-specific files named “Bekostigingsbestanden”. functions package extract information files related switching studies. facilitates HEIs gain insight prevalence switching studies. Flows can visualised Sankey diagram.

title: Gain Insight In Switching Studies
text: can install development version wisselstroom GitHub : want vignettes well:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ed2c/wisselstroom") devtools::install_github("ed2c/wisselstroom", dependencies = TRUE, build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Gain Insight In Switching Studies
text: Read VLPBEK file read_vlpbek_data(): results one large data set. Hidden data set different sub data sets, contain information enrolment degrees. ease access information, make vlpbek object function vlpbek(): Gain insights using compact_vlpbek function. resulting object contains summary information related switching HEIs /programs, can plotted using instance plot_brinflows():
code: path_to_file <- here::here("extdata", "VLPBEK_2025_20240115_99XX.csv") my_vlpbek_data <- read_vlpbek_data(path_to_file) my_vlpbek <- vlpbek(my_vlpbek_data) my_vlpbek_compact <- compact_vlpbek(my_vlpbek) plot_brinflows(my_vlpbekcompact, display_labels = TRUE)

title: Gain Insight In Switching Studies
text: Read introduction vignette background information: Browse vignettes:
code: vignette("wisselstroom", package = "wisselstroom") browseVignettes("wisselstroom")

title: Gain Insight In Switching Studies
text: code Sankey diagram adapted code found end may 2024 https://github.com/ssp3nc3r/ggSankeyGrad.

title: Gives insight in enrolments year after degree — after_degree
text: program_of_interest string containing 5-character program code interest my_vlpbek_compact vlpbek_compact object prop_exam boolean, default FALSE, set TRUE propedeutic exam

title: Gives insight in enrolments year after degree — after_degree
text: list 10 objects program_of_interest program code entered degree D propedeutic, AD, B Bachelor M Master brin_own brin_own my_vlpbek_compact object academic_year_from earliest academic year data academic_year_to latest academic year data n_students number students degree brin_own/program_of_interest academic_year_from n_students_enrolment_type_single number students one enrolment brin/program per academic year n_students_enrolment_type_multiple difference two numbers students from_to_single dataframe 7 columns counts per flow, students enrolment_type = single from_to_multiple dataframe 7 columns flow information per (anonymized) student, students enrolment_type = single

title: Makes a compacter version of a vlpbek object, with some summaries — compact_vlpbek
text: vlpbek_object list 7 objects brin_own text containing brin higher educational institution funding file refers enrolments_degrees_compact data frame one row per academic year, student, brin program_code, adorned date_degree applicable note student single enrolment per year presences_brin dataframe one row per student per academic year displaying enrolmentinformation regarding brin: either brin_own /, outside presences_level dataframe one row per student per academic year displaying enrolmentinformation regarding level: HBO-AD, HBO-BA, HBO-MA, WO-BA, WO-MA switches dataframe columns from_brin, from_program_code, to_brin_to_program_code, n_students students df enrolment_degrees_compact, one enrolment per year, receive diploma first year summary_presences_brin presences_brin per academic year summarised students summary_presences_level presences_leveln per academic year summarised students

what: Plots the global flows between brin_own, other HE and not in HE — plot_brinflows
title: Plots the global flows between brin_own, other HE and not in HE — plot_brinflows
text: plot_brinflows() takes summary_presences_brin vlpbek_compact list, turns sankey diagram

title: Plots the global flows between brin_own, other HE and not in HE — plot_brinflows
code: plot_brinflows(   my_vlp_compact,   color_brin_own = "#853887",   color_other_he = "#246ABE",   color_brin_own_other_he = "#00B17E",   color_outside_he = "grey",   label_brin_own = "this HEI",   label_other_he = "other HEI",   label_outside_he = "outside HE",   padding = 2,   alpha = 0.4,   display_labels = TRUE,   match_label_color = TRUE,   label_fontface = "bold",   label_size = 10 )

title: Plots the global flows between brin_own, other HE and not in HE — plot_brinflows
text: my_vlp_compact vlpbek_compact object color_brin_own string containing color code used brin_own color_other_he string containing color code used color_brin_own_other_he string containing color code used brin_own & color_outside_he string containing color code used outside label_brin_own string use instead "brin_own" label_other_he string use instead "other_HE" label_outside_he string use instead "outside_HE" padding constant used displaying space flows alpha numeric, transparancy colors (0 = complete transparent, 1 = opaque) display_labels boolean used displaying labels match_label_color boolean used indicate labels color nodes label_fontface string used styling font labels label_size number indicating font size labels
